title: 109_s485
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Geologic Mapping Reauthorization Act of 2005". The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to address the lack of modern, digital geologic maps for 75% of the United States. Changes include updating planning processes and identifying resources more effectively. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to improve the availability of modern geologic maps for 75% of the United States. Changes include updating planning processes and identifying resources more effectively, as well as adding provisions for recreation and public awareness. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to include "management" in its purpose. Additionally, deadlines for actions by the United States Geological Survey are established. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to include "management" in its purpose, and deadlines for actions by the United States Geological Survey are established, with specific timelines for submission and completion. SEC. 5 amends the National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 by updating objectives and components of the geologic mapping program. SEC. 6 specifies components related to land management agencies. SEC. 7 establishes a Geologic Mapping Advisory Committee. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to update membership requirements, including representatives from land management agencies. The Chief Geologist role is revised within the Act. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to update membership requirements, including adding 2 representatives from the private sector. Section 5(b) is amended to include providing a scientific overview of geologic maps used by Federal agencies. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is amended to update membership requirements, including adding 2 representatives from the private sector. Section 5(a)(1) is amended to change the number of members from 10 to 11. SEC. 8 amends Section 7(a) of the National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 to include all maps funded by the National Cooperative Geologic Mapping Program. SEC. 9 updates the reporting timeline to every 3 years after the National Geologic Mapping Reauthorization Act of 2005. SEC. 10 addresses authorization of appropriations and allocation. SEC. 10 of the National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 authorizes $64,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2015. Amendments include increasing the number of maps funded and updating reporting timelines. The National Geologic Mapping Act of 1992 is being reauthorized and amended through S. 485.
